text.p: Headlines from major national newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
EL PAIS
- Cuban leader Fidel Castro accelerates bad relations with Prime Minister Jose Maria Aznar into a diplomatic crisis by withdrawing its earlier acceptance of a new Spanish ambassador.
- Catalan leader Jordi Pujol warns government not to rush labour reform.
EL MUNDO
- Parliament approved on Tuesday a draft for bringing the rights and regulations of military service in line with those applicable to conscientious objectors.
DIARIO 16
- Cabinet reacts coldly and rules out an escalation of crisis with Cuba after Castro surprises Aznar by rejecting Spain's ambassador.
ABC
- Cuba's communist regimen retracted its approval for a new Spanish ambassador in an interview with daily ABC.
CINCO DIAS
- Employment improves in third quarter and Aznar reiterates his commitment to labour reforms.
- Companies within the Ibex-35 index of leading shares have performed better than general index.
EXPANSION
- Spain's tourist sector worried that conflict with Cuba could affect their investments in the island which have largely been conducted through the state.
- Telecommunications group Retevision's privatisation will total at least 64 billion pesetas.
GACETA DE LOS NEGOCIOS
- Aznar will reject a labour reform pact reached by unions and employers which he considers insufficient.
- Novartis, the multinational created by the merger of Ciba-Geigy and Sandoz, will double its current production of medicines in Spain.
- Increase in employers' contributions to Social Security resulting from pensions pact signed in October, could threaten many businesses who operate in competitive markets with bankruptcy. mad mcm
